answers.answer: Hi!Your symptoms appear to be due to hypothyroidism. It would be best to consult an endocrine specialist to monitor your thyroid levels. You can also feel fatigue and have dry skin if you have diabetes, severe anemia, hormonal imbalance or Sjogren’s syndrome.Hence, please discuss this with your treating doctor. Take care!

question: I have had this for going on 11 years now. In 2002 I had radiation to kill my thyroid to this day I still have my medication adjusted about every 6 months. I get sick very easily, I get so tired and worn down. If my thyroid levels become off I seem to retain water badly with major edema, my hair starts falling out, I also seem to now be getting extremely dry skin on about the first inch of my scalp under my hair. Is there anything else that I can do to help all of this. I feel like I am always sick and tired and I am sick and tired of being sick and tired.
